column2: Potential deduction up to $41,142 (25% of $164,567 net self‑employment income) if W‑2 wages exist; contributions can be made for 2022 by the tax return due date (including extensions).

Employee deferral limit $20,500 less $9,000 already contributed (remaining $11,500) plus employer profit‑sharing up to 25% of compensation; total 2022 cap $61,000; potential deduction about $52,642 if compensation of $164,567.

column1: Business mileage (home office to temporary office)
column2: If your home is your principal place of business, travel from home to another work location is deductible. Using 3,900 miles (2 trips/week Oct–Dec) at the 2022 rate of 62.5¢ per mile yields a deduction of $2,437.50.
Home office portion depreciated as nonresidential real property over 39 years. With a building value of $600,000 and business use of 15.2%, annual depreciation is about $2,339.
Section 179 allows immediate expensing of up to $1,080,000 of qualified property in 2022 (reduced when total property exceeds $2,700,000). For $2,000 of business equipment, the deduction is $2,000.
Qualified property placed in service in 2022 can claim a 100% special depreciation allowance (bonus depreciation) for the entire cost. For $3,000 of equipment, the deduction is $3,000.

For amounts paid or incurred after 31 Dec 2020 and before 1 Jan 2023, the 50% limit on meal deductions doesn’t apply to food or beverages from a restaurant, making them 100% deductible. For $1,000 of meals, the deduction is $1,000.

Cell phones are no longer listed property; business use of an employer‑provided cell phone is excludable as a working condition fringe. Deductible portion equals the business‑use percentage—e.g., 60% of a $1,483.41 phone bill ≈ $890.

Work‑related education that maintains or improves skills or is required by your employer is deductible; expenses can include tuition, books, supplies and travel. Assuming $1,000 in courses and materials, the deduction is $1,000.
Ordinary and necessary fees on a business bank account are deductible. For 38 wire transfers at ~$25 each, the total deduction is about $950.
Expenses for insurance on your home are deductible to the extent of business use. At 15.2% business use and an annual premium of $1,500, the deductible portion is about $228.
The business portion of utilities (electricity, gas, water, trash) is deductible. Using 15.2% business use, the 2022 allocation is about $456.
